feed.title: SAP Community - SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud
feed.subtitle: SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: #CoE#GZHX如何不显示SAP标准科目表
entry.content: 客户需要用自己的一套会计科目表，而不使用SAP标准科目表。如何保证在生产系统中，SAP标准科目表科目不体现（即不显示）

entry.title: #CoE#GZHX如何修改会计凭证原因代码
entry.content: 会计凭证原因代码是否能配置为可修改。在IMG界面，可修改的字段目前只有BKPF-XBLNR【参考】，没有RSTGR字段可供配置修改

entry.title: #CoE#GZHX如何在计划协议 LZ 时使用 POD 功能
entry.content: 销售 POD 功能 仅支持 销售项目类型 TAN（标准行项目）CBXN（免费)， 客户想使用计划协议 LZ 时使用 POD 功能， 但是 计划协议行项目类型不允许修改，无法使用 POD

entry.title: Alternative Process for Reverse Factoring in S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition without Scope Item 4AV
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

I have a question regarding the implementation of a reverse factoring process in S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.

**Background:**
- Customer uses reverse factoring (supply chain finance)
- Dedicated scope item 4AV has been scoped out based on customer requirements
- Manual workaround using standard apps and postings is preferred

**Business Flow:**
1. Invoice received from supplier: ¥1,000,000 (accounts payable created)
2. Customer requests reverse factoring from factoring company
3. Factoring company pays supplier: ¥950,000 (¥50,000 factoring fee deducted from supplier)
4. Customer pays factoring company on extended payment date: ¥1,000,000

**Proposed Accounting Entries:**

1. AP creation (Feb 10):
DR: Expense 1,000,000
CR: Accounts Payable (Supplier account) 1,000,000
→ App: Supplier Invoicing (MIRO equivalent)

2. Factoring company pays supplier (Feb 15):
DR: Accounts Payable (Supplier account) 1,000,000
CR: Accounts Payable (Factoring company account) 1,000,000
→ App: Manual Journal Entry (FB01 equivalent)?
*Or should this clear the supplier AP and create a new AP to factoring company?*

3. Payment to factoring company on extended due date (Apr 30):
DR: Accounts Payable (Factoring company account) 1,000,000
CR: Bank 1,000,000
→ App: Post Outgoing Payments (F-53 equivalent)

**Questions:**

1. Is this flow technically feasible in S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition? Are the App IDs I mentioned correct, or should I use different apps?

2. What is the correct way to handle the AP transfer from supplier to factoring company in step 2? Should I:
- Use manual journal entry to transfer AP between vendors?
- Clear supplier AP and create new AP document for factoring company?
- Use a different approach?

3. How should we manage the factoring fee (¥50,000)? Should it be:
- Recorded separately when payment occurs?
- Included in the initial AP transfer entry?
- Not recorded by customer at all (since supplier bears the cost)?

4. Are there any special master data settings required for reverse factoring suppliers (e.g., payment terms, vendor account groups, or other configurations)?

5. If this approach is not possible, what alternative process would you recommend? Please include:
- Which apps to use (with App IDs if possible)
- Accounting entries for each step
- Master data setup requirements

Any guidance would be greatly appreciated!

Best regards

entry.title: Why are Consumption Mode and Consumption Period fields missing in “Manage Product Master Data” App
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I am working on SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, and I found an inconsistency between two apps for maintaining product master data.

In the “Manage Product Master Data” app (used by business users), the following MRP fields are not available under Planning/MRP views:

  • Consumption Mode

  • Forward Consumption Period

  • Backward Consumption Period

  • MRP Group related consumption settings

  • Other detailed MRP3 control fields

However, in the “Change Material / Manage Material Master (MM02)” expert app, these fields are available, and we can maintain consumption settings normally (e.g., Strategy 40 / 70 materials).

My question

Is this behavior expected in S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition?
Why are these consumption-related fields completely missing from Manage Product Master Data, even when the material uses strategy groups that require consumption (40, 70, B6, etc.)?

What we have checked

  • MRP Type = PD

  • Strategy Group = 40 / 70

  • All relevant master data settings exist

  • The fields appear correctly in the expert material app (MM02)

  • No option to enable these fields through Custom Fields & Logic (CFL)

  • No obvious setting in SSCUI or configuration to expose these fields

Business Impact

Business users need to maintain consumption settings, but they can only use Manage Product Master Data, and the app does not provide these fields.
We want to understand if:

  1. This is SAP’s intended design (only expert app can maintain consumption settings),
    or

  2. If there is a way to make the missing fields available in the simplified master data app.

✔ Question to SAP / Community

  • Is this a known limitation of the “Manage Product Master Data” app?

  • Is there any official documentation explaining which MRP fields are intentionally restricted in this app?

  • Is there a recommended way to allow business users to maintain consumption mode/period?

  • Do we need to assign a specific business role (e.g., SAP_BR_PRODMASTER_SPECIALIST) to make these fields appear?

Any guidance or confirmation from SAP or other practitioners would be greatly appreciated!

Thank you.

entry.title: Linking Outgoing Check Information to Journal Entry Items for PDF Preview in Create Correspondence
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

Is there a way to access or fill data in the Journal Entry XML data source (from either Ledger or Entry)?

Here’s what I’m trying to do:
I create a Vendor Payment using Post Outgoing Payments. After that, it links to Manage Outgoing Checks, where the PaymentDocuement is connected to the AccountingDocument from the Journal Entry created during posting.

I want to know if it’s possible to automatically copy the check number from the Outgoing Check to the Journal Entry Item. Once that value is available, I’ll use it to preview the PDF in Manage Journal Entries (Document Type “KZ”) and then click Create Correspondence to view the PDF report.

Best regards,
Oliver

entry.title: Issue with Download Template Functionality in RAP-Based Mass Upload Table (ADT)
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I’ve implemented a table with a mass upload feature, but the “Download Template” option isn’t working as expected.

I created an abstract entity with a rawstring data type and additional parameters to accept the attachment. In the behavior definition, I’ve defined a static action to generate the Excel file and assign it to the result. However, while I can successfully upload the template using similar approach, the download functionality doesn’t trigger, and no errors are shown.

Please find the screenshot below for your reference.
Could you please review my approach and let me know if I’m missing something or if any changes are required?

Abstract entity:

Behavior definition and implementing class:

Thank you in Advance.

SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition ABAP RESTful Application Programming Model  SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Research and Development ABAP Development

entry.title: How to enable access to the Request URI field in the OData Error Log app (view-only role)
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,
 
(SAP Public Cloud, 3SL CBC)
 
In our SAP test environment, I’m trying to grant a colleague access to view the Request URI field within the OData Error Log app. Currently, the field shows the message:
 /sap/opu/odata/sap/***No_authority_to_see_detail*** 
 
We have a dedicated role that provides view-only access to audit and log information. My goal is to adjust this role so that the colleague can read the Request URI field without granting any additional administrative permissions.
 
Dedicated role:
Global Administrator:
 
What I’ve done so far:
• Added the relevant Business Catalogs to allow access to the app and system.
• However, the role is still not authorised to see the Request URI field.
 
What I need help with:
• Which specific business catalog(s) or authorisation objects are required to make the Request URI field visible in the OData Error Log app.
 
Any insights or guidance would be greatly appreciated!
 
Thank you in advance,
Sjoerd

entry.title: Share one number range across 2 systems to facilitate phased migration from SAP ECC to S/4
entry.content:
Our requirement is to have SAP ECC and S/4 Public Cloud, both multi-company, to "share" the same Material Number range, and therefor prevent that a newly created Material in one system gets a Number assigned where in the other system a Material already exists with the same Number.

Basis for this requirement is another requirement: to be able to migrate Materials from SAP ECC to S/4 while keeping the Material Number from SAP ECC.

We consciously choose to keep the same 8-digit number format (from 10000000 to 89999999) in S/4 as in SAP ECC to avoid different number formats in S/4.

In SAP ECC, external numbering is applied (user chooses a number) within this 8-digit number range and the used Material Numbers are scattered all over the entire range.

Another important requirement: In S/4, a new Material must have a Number assigned automatically (user cannot choose) from the same 8-digit number range. 

So basically, we want S/4 to issue new Numbers automatically from this Number Range, but "skip" Numbers that already exist as Material Number in both systems.

In parallel, SAP ECC should be able to check that the Number a user chooses for a new Material doesn't already exist in S/4.

In the mean time, it must remain possible to migrate Materials from ECC to S/4 while keeping their 8-digit Material Number.

Important to know: it is not feasible to split the 8-digit number range in multiple smaller number ranges, because of the scattering. 

I would like to receive possible solution options for this challenge.

entry.title: System doesnt calculate safety stock or MAD (Mean Absolute Deviation) in automatic reorder point
entry.content:
Hi All, I’m using MRP type V2 (Automatic Reorder Point Planning) with automatic calculation of both reorder point and safety stock based on consumption history in SAP S4 HANA public cloud.

Issue:
When I run the forecast, the system calculates the reorder point, but it does not calculate safety stock or MAD (Mean Absolute Deviation). I’ve checked the configuration for the MRP type, and it includes both reorder point and safety stock.

Details:

  • MRP Type: V2
  • Lot Size: EX
  • Service Level: 99.9%
  • Planned Delivery Time: 4 days
  • Forecast Model: Constant
  • Forecast Period: Monthly

Question:
Am I missing any configuration or step that would enable the system to calculate safety stock and MAD during forecasting?
